eg

Class Prefs

  • java.lang.Object
    • eg.Prefs

  • public final class Prefs
extends java.lang.Object
    The preferences for the editor and for projects. The editor properties correspond to the keys defined as constants in this class. Other key/property pairs can be added.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static java.lang.String EXCHG_PREFIX
      Prefix for keys of properties of the exchange editor
      static java.lang.String FILE_VIEW_KEY
      Key for showing the file view; a 'Yes-No' property
      static java.lang.String FONT_KEY
      Key for the font name
      static java.lang.String FONT_SIZE_KEY
      Key for the font size
      static java.lang.String ICON_SIZE_KEY
      Key for the icon size which is 'Small' or 'Large'
      static java.lang.String INDENT_UNIT_KEY
      Key for the indent unit which is a certain number of spaces
      static java.lang.String LAF_KEY
      Key for the LaF which is 'System' or 'Java default'
      static java.lang.String LANG_KEY
      Key for the language which is a constant in Languages as String
      static java.lang.String LINE_NR_KEY
      Key for showing line numbers; a 'Yes-No' property
      static java.lang.String PROJ_CONFIG_FILE
      The name of the properties file to store the configuration of a project
      static java.lang.String RECENT_DIR_KEY
      Key for the last used directory to save or open a file
      static java.lang.String STATUSBAR_KEY
      Key for showing the status bar; a 'Yes-No' property
      static java.lang.String TABBAR_KEY
      Key for showing the tabbar; a 'Yes-No' property
      static java.lang.String THEME_KEY
      Key for the background theme which is 'White' or 'Dark'
      static java.lang.String TOOLBAR_KEY
      Key for showing the toolbar; a 'Yes-No' property
      static java.lang.String WORDWRAP_KEY
      Key for enabling wordwrap; a 'Yes-No' property

    • Constructor Detail

      • Prefs

        public Prefs()
        Creates a Prefs that reads from and writes to the Prefs.properties file.

        The Prefs file is stored in the .eadgyth folder (see EADGYTH_DATA_DIR) if the folder exists.

        Every new Prefs object accesses the same set of properties which are loaded upon first creation. If the Prefs file does not (yet) exist the editor properties are pre-set.

      • Prefs

        public Prefs(java.lang.String projectDir)
        Creates a Prefs that reads from and writes to a ProjConfig.properties file in the specified project directory. The properties are loaded if the file exists. Every new Prefs object accesses an own set of properties.
        Parameters:
        projectDir - the directory

    • Method Detail

      • setProperty

        public void setProperty(java.lang.String key,
                        java.lang.String value)
        Sets a new value for the property that corresponds to the specified key or adds a new key/value pair if the key is not contained in the property list
        Parameters:
        key - the property key
        value - the new value

      • setYesNoProperty

        public void setYesNoProperty(java.lang.String key,
                             boolean state)
        Sets a new value for the 'Yes-No' property that corresponds to the specified key or adds a new key/value pair if the key is not contained in the property list
        Parameters:
        key - the property key
        state - true for 'Yes', false for 'No'

      • property

        public java.lang.String property(java.lang.String key)
        Returns the value of the property that corresponds to the specified key
        Parameters:
        key - the property key
        Returns:
        the value; null if the property could not be found

      • yesNoProperty

        public boolean yesNoProperty(java.lang.String key)
        Returns if the value of the 'Yes-No' property that corresponds to the specified key is 'Yes'
        Parameters:
        key - the property key
        Returns:
        true if the value is 'Yes', false otherwise

      • load

        public void load()
        Loads the properties from this properties file if it exists

      • store

        public void store()
        Writes the properties to this properties file if the parent directory of the file exists
